abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.

inlineContent.text: OpenSwiftUI provides views, controls, and layout structures for declaring your app’s user interface. The framework provides event handlers for delivering taps, gestures, and other types of input to your app, and tools to manage the flow of data from your app’s models down to the views and controls that users see and interact with.
Define your app structure using the
protocol, and populate it with scenes that contain the views that make up your app’s user interface. Create your own custom views that conform to the

protocol, and compose them with OpenSwiftUI views for displaying text, images, and custom shapes using stacks, lists, and more. Apply powerful modifiers to built-in views and your own views to customize their rendering and interactivity. Share code between apps on multiple platforms with views and controls that adapt to their context and presentation.
You can integrate OpenSwiftUI views with objects from the

frameworks to take further advantage of platform-specific functionality. You can also customize accessibility support in OpenSwiftUI, and localize your app’s interface for different languages, countries, or cultural regions.

Information passed to a timeline view’s content callback.
A style appropriate for foreground separator or border lines.
A matrix to use in an RGBA color transformation.
A kind for the content shape of a view.
A direction in which OpenSwiftUI can lay out content.
A background material type.

A proxy for a text view that custom text renderers use.
A representation of a color that adapts to a given context.
A container view that defines its content as a function of its own size and

A  function defined by a two-dimensional curve that maps an input
progress in the range [0,1] to an output progress that is also in the
range [0,1]. By changing the shape of the curve, the effective speed
of an animation or other interpolation can be changed.
Enhance your views with graphical effects and customized drawings.
A transition that inserts by moving in from the leading edge, and
removes by moving out towards the trailing edge.
The way a view changes over time to create a smooth visual transition from
one state to another.
An indication of a scene’s operational state.
A view that arranges its subviews in a horizontal line.
A key for accessing a layout value of a layout container’s subviews.
Returns the result of recomputing the view’s body with the provided
animation, and runs the completion when all animations are complete.
Defines the shape of a rounded rectangle’s corners.

A value with a modifier applied to it.

A scene that presents a group of identically structured windows.

that uses a different transition for

Understand how OpenSwiftUI performs asynchronous rendering when hosted in UIKit views.
A shape provider that fills its shape.
A view that overlays its subviews, aligning them in both axes.
An ellipse aligned inside the frame of the view containing it.
OpenSwiftUI is a modern way to declare user interfaces for any Apple
platform, Linux and Windows. Create beautiful, dynamic apps faster than
ever before.
